column4: Would someone please watch this video illustrating the video issue I have with 10.10 and let me know if they've encountered it? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0req-d9jXAk
It does however dissipate after 5 minutes and then stops completely
It doesn't happen every time i start the laptop
I think I'll start with compiz
Mine happes upon bootup after being off all night
ya i need a new fan too...
looks kinda like the wrong refresh rate. are you running nvidia?
if you type xrandr in a terminal you
supposed to have better opensource support
you'll see what the card is currently set at
if it were a refresh rate issue wouldn't it always do that, instead of stopping after a few minutes?
i don't know how to tell which one is the refresh rate

k. ati isn't my preferred card choice.. I really don't know much about how to configure it.. xrandr handles the configuration for resolution and refresh rate.. if the refresh is close but not correct the card might be trying to compensate.. if it's a separate card and not built into the motherboard then it might be worth the effort to pull it out and put it back to reseat it.. just shooting in the dark here.
